title: Digital Well-Being and Inclusive Design Strategies in Video Conferencing-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Practical-focused program for enhancing digital well-being competencies of corporate managers/leaders

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more multimodal communication strategies to promote inclusive participation in video conferencing environments.
Learners can create meeting design guidelines based on the eight dimensions of digital well-being (educational context).
Learners can develop a video conferencing operation manual (including checklists) considering learner diversity (accessibility, cultural backgrounds).
Learners can establish and present actionable digital well-being plans applicable to real work environments through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
